title: Alzheimer 's in the U.S : lifetime risks , by age and gender
summary: This grouped bar chart represents 2 different Countrys on X-axis for 2 groups Men, and Women. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Risk Percentage.
Out of all 2 groups, Women had the highest Risk Percentage in Country 65 years and Men had the lowest Risk Percentage in Country 45 years.
Among all the Countrys, Men had the highest Risk Percentage 195.0 in Country 65 years and lowest value 103.0 in Country 45 years.
Country 65 years and 45 years had the biggest gap of 92.0 between the highest and lowest Risk Percentage found for Men.
min_summary: This grouped bar chart shows Risk Percentage on the Y-axis for 2 different Countrys for 2 groups Men, and Women that are presented on the X-axis.
Country 65 years had the maximum Risk Percentage among all 2 groups, and it was for Women. The minimum Risk Percentage was observed in Country 45 years for Men.
mid_summary: This grouped bar chart represents 2 different Countrys on X-axis for 2 groups Men, and Women. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Risk Percentage.
Out of all 2 groups, Women had the highest Risk Percentage in Country 65 years and Men had the lowest Risk Percentage in Country 45 years.
Among all the Countrys, Men had the highest Risk Percentage 195.0 in Country 65 years and lowest value 103.0 in Country 45 years.
Country 65 years and 45 years had the biggest gap of 92.0 between the highest and lowest Risk Percentage found for Men.
max_summary: This grouped bar chart represents 2 different Countrys on X-axis for 2 groups Men, and Women. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Risk Percentage.
In Country 65 years, Women had the highest Risk Percentage 211.0 among the 2 groups and in 45 years, Men had the lowest Risk Percentage 103.0.
In Country 65 years, Men had the maximum Risk Percentage and it saw the lowest in Country 45 years out of all 2 Countrys.
Country 65 years and 45 years had the biggest gap of 92.0 between the highest and lowest Risk Percentage found for Men.
Among all 2 groups, Men had the gap of 92.0 between the maximum and minimum Risk Percentage observed in Country 65 years and 45 years respectively.
On average, the Country 65 years had the highest Risk Percentage for all 2 groups Men, and Women. Whereas 45 years had the lowest average Risk Percentage.
